pullRequest.title: Fixed Uphold configuration of prod builds for Travis CD
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue being fixed or feature implemented


Used the Travis Files Automated Encryption to securely replace Uphold API test keys with the production ones when deploying prod builds.
Removed skip_cleanup parameter (deprecated in dpl v2 and replaced with cleanup param being false by default)
More info here: https://blog.travis-ci.com/2019-08-27-deployment-tooling-dpl-v2-preview-release
What was done?

Test builds of prod versions were using incorrect Uphold API keys
How Has This Been Tested?



Breaking Changes


Checklist:


 I have performed a self-review of my own code
 I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
 I have added or updated relevant unit/integration/functional/e2e tests
 I have made corresponding changes to the documentation

For repository code-owners and collaborators only

 I have assigned this pull request to a milestone

commit.message:
Used the Travis Files Automated Encryption to securely replace Uphold API test keys with
the production ones when deploying prod builds
Removed skip_cleanup parameter (deprecated in dpl v2 and replaced with cleanup param being false by default)

nodes.bodyText: Will a testnet build use this encrypted file also?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -77,6 +77,7 @@ script:
 - ./gradlew test
 - ./gradlew assemble_testNet3Debug
 - rm -rf .gradle/4.4
+- openssl aes-256-cbc -K $encrypted_1615d4cf65a2_key -iv $encrypted_1615d4cf65a2_iv -in .deploy/UpholdConstants.enc -out uphold-integration/src/main/java/org/dash/wallet/integration/uphold/data/UpholdConstants.java -d
